alert.note: Alert for Assumption; East Baton Rouge; Iberville; Northern Livingston; Pointe Coupee; West Baton Rouge; Western Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 8:02PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Ascension, West Baton Rouge, southeastern Pointe Coupee, northwestern Livingston, Iberville, East Baton Rouge and northwestern Assumption Parishes through 845 PM CST... At 801 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Baker to 6 miles east of Lake Fausse Pointe. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Baker, Denham Springs, Plaquemine, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, St. Gabriel, Walker, Addis, Brusly, White Castle, Rosedale, Grosse Tete, Westminster, Geismar, Erwinville, Watson, Ramah, Bayou Sorrel and Shenandoah. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 134 and 175. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 18. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Assumption; East Baton Rouge; Iberville; Northern Livingston; Pointe Coupee; West Baton Rouge; Western Ascension
